text: Vapor retarder type and perm rating confirmed (e.g., ≤0.1 perm for Class I)
Product listed on approved submittals and compatible with adjacent materials
Sealants, tapes, and primers used are approved and compatible
Materials stored dry and undamaged prior to install
Substrate dry, clean, and smooth (no protrusions, moisture, or contaminants)
All penetrations pre-coordinated with trades
Continuous installation without tears or holes
Seams overlapped (minimum 100 mm / 4”) and sealed with approved tape
Membrane turned up at floor slab and down over top plates / headers
Penetrations sealed with gaskets, boots, or tapes (MEP, structural)
Backed up with rigid board, batt insulation, or sheathing as per design
Sheet lapped a minimum of 150 mm (6”) and sealed
Penetrations (conduits, footings) sealed individually
No punctures or wrinkles under reinforcement or rebar
Vapor barrier extended under footings or up vertical face (as per detail)
Vapor retarder installed over deck and under insulation as per spec
Torch or self-adhered membrane sealed at all laps and terminations
Mechanical fasteners used only where permitted by manufacturer
QA/QC inspection with air barrier continuity check
Any repairs completed with full bond and continuity re-established
